head.title: 'Survivor,' and Our Lives Today; A Changed Landscape

hedline.hl1: 'Survivor,' and Our Lives Today; A Changed Landscape

abstract.p: Abby Wolf letter comments on August 25 Business Day article on CBS reality program, Survivor; drawing

block.p: Re '' 'Survivor' Puts CBS in Land of Superlatives'' (Business Day, Aug. 25):
How the American cultural landscape has changed in a year.
Re '' 'Survivor' Puts CBS in Land of Superlatives'' (Business Day, Aug. 25):
How the American cultural landscape has changed in a year.
After the shooting at Columbine High School the news media inundated us with stories about bullies, nerds and misfits and the potential deadliness of cliques.

Now we have not only a contest for president that gets considerable coverage for its ''cool kid versus geek'' dynamic, but also one of the most successful television shows in history deriving its popularity from the suspense over who will be voted off the island by a group of peers.
I'm happy not to be going back to high school this post-''Survivor'' -- I mean, election -- season.
